{"step_by_step_thinking": "Infective endocarditis is an infection of the inner layer of the heart, the endocardium. It typically occurs when bacteria or other germs from another part of your body, such as your mouth, spread through your bloodstream and attach to damaged areas in your heart. Features of infective endocarditis include myocardial abscess, vegetation along cusps, and perforation of cusp. However, thrombus in left atria is not a feature of infective endocarditis.
